author: chedruid

text:
For whatever reason Colors struck me as a bit...bland.  Technically speaking, it is a better made game than it's immediate predecessors, but it lacked...soul, I guess.  It's certainly not a BAD game, but I couldn't really get that into it, either (I had the same reaction with Donkey Kong Country Returns, for comparison).

Generations, though, is awesome: the biggest flaw is that it's too short.
author: tallwhiteninja

text: Now, all that said, I agree Sonic '06 is not NEARLY as bad as it's made out to be: people tend to think it's "worst game of all time" caliber, and even with all of it's flaws it's nowhere close.  I enjoyed it enough to beat it, after all: I always thought 3D Sonic was darn fun despite it's flaws (if they'd just improved the damn camera and stuck with Sonic Adventure gameplay, it would have been fine).  I also thought Silver's gameplay was a pretty cool idea, albeit poorly executed.
author: tallwhiteninja

text: The story was not the only bad thing about '06 (and, yes, I both own and have beaten it).  It's loaded to the brim with glitches, the loading times are atrocious, the overworld is one of the ugliest, most generic places I've ever seen in a video game, the sections where you temporarily play as the sidekicks (Tales, Knuckles, Rouge, etc) suck, and there are some parts that are poorly and rather obnoxiously designed (the silver spheres in Aquatic Base, for instance).
author: tallwhiteninja
